First, it was obvious that Lindsey was swelling with fat, her belly oozing forward, her face rounding out, arms thickening with soft mass, ass invading space in every direction, but then, something else started to happen.

Her jeans changed into a black pair of work pants, her tight T-shirt began to display a McChubbies emblem and transformed into a blue polo, and her hair tied itself up in a bun as a visor appeared on top of her head.

Isaac couldn't help but laugh as he felt Lindsey got what was coming to her, while Julie and Chris simply looked on in awe.

Lindsey checked her weight card as her number increased from a svelte 123 pounds to a thick 173 pounds.

"Wow, fuck this game!" she cursed angrily as she dropped her card, "Isaac's right, we should stop playing!"

"Oh no you don't-" said Isaac, "Now that it's bitten you in the ass you want to quit? Tough titty, my dear! We're gonna see this one through!"

Chris laughed and Julie managed a smirk.

"Isaac's right," said Julie, "Grave consequences, whatever they might be- aren't too attractive an option, are they?"

Lindsey nodded in defeat.

"Here goes nothing," said Chris as he rolled the die and prepared for the worst.

After moving his piece 3 spots, Chris drew his card and read aloud-
1551211.title: "Entry level position at McChubbies."

15512111.content:
"Certified personal trainer," read Chris aloud, "On every one of your turns, you may select a player to lose 10 pounds."

Isaac was a bit angry that Chris hadn't experienced any negative effects yet, but the card could still be helpful to him, so he remained friendly- maybe he could lose 10 pounds on each of Chris' turns, and in 3 turns he'd be back to normal... assuming the game didn't keep throwing crap cards at him.

Chris was tapping his chin softly with one finger as he pondered what his next move would be. He could help Isaac out- they had been friends the longest, but then again he was having just a bit too much fun watching his friend squirm. Lindsey was an obvious choice- she was the heaviest player right now and she could use a little help. He was perfectly happy with his weight right now, so he didn't at all plan on using it on himself.

The choice no one probably imagined him making was Julie. She was already thinner than she had started out, a good deal thinner. However, at 150 pounds, she was still chubby. Perhaps the 10 pound loss would demote her from chubby to just thick. That could be interesting, and it would be a nice thing to do, perhaps- to let Julie experience some of her life at a lower weight, even if it was only momentary. He'd made his mind, for the sake of messing with the two players who had gained weight and the one who had lost it.

"I pick Julie," he said simply, much to the displeasure of Isaac and Lindsey, who crossed their arms over their chests almost simultaneously.

Julie dropped to 140 pounds- she hadn't been this weight since middle school. She was still not quite thin, somewhere between chubby and thick, depending on your preferences, but she was looking better now (At least to Chris) than she did at the beginning of the game.

"What the hell dude?" asked Isaac angrily, "Why didn't you help me out?"

Chris merely shrugged, "I just felt like it was the right decision."

"Well, you better help me out next turn."

Another shrug.

"Ugh-" was all Isaac could manage as he realize it was once again his turn. Still, his strong sense of duty forced him to pick up the die and roll it with minimal complaint.

"Please be good-" was all he could whisper as he picked up the card.
15512111.title: "Certified personal trainer!"

15512112.content:
"Certified personal chef," he read aloud, "Each one of your turns, starting now, you must pick a player to gain 10 pounds or gain them yourself."

Julie, Isaac and Lindsey looked at each other, fearful of what Chris would do with this new power.

"Hmmm...." he pondered mischievously, "Who to pick, who to pick."

Each player was about to make their case, when Chris raised his hand and pointed it at Isaac.

"Hey, wanna be the heaviest player in the game again?" he asked, a wicked grin stretched across his face.

"No!" shrieked Isaac angrily.

"Well, too bad, cause that's what you're gonna be, I pick Isaac!"

Apparently, the game understood, because within seconds Isaac's pants experienced a slight tear at the seams as they struggled to contain his larger body.

"Fuck you Chris, what the hell, you haven't gained any weight!"

"Yeah," said Chris laughing, "And I plan to keep it that way, we can't all ruin our bodies, huh, chubbo?"

"Don't listen to him, Isaac," said Julie, "It's not that bad, and I trust he'll get his before the game is over."

"I'm so scared!" mocked Chris as Julie handed Isaac the die.

"Thanks Julie," said Isaac, trying to ignore Chris best he could.

"Try not to get too fat on this turn, Isaac."

"Screw you."

Isaac drew his card after moving his game piece 5 spaces and read nervously-
15512112.title: "Certified personal chef!"

"Gain 50 pounds and, if there are any players who have drawn the 'entry level position at McChubbies' card, they must obey you for the remainder of the game."

Shirt changed from an overly tight t-shirt to a polo with the McChubbies logo on it, the same color as Lindsey's only that the collar was of a golden color, denoting his position as manager. A visor also popped onto his head, and his pants, which before had been to small to fit his swollen frame, changed to a much larger pair of black work pants. "Come on Isaac, don't be a dick!" Lindsey urged him "You know better!"

"Yes, sir-" said Lindsey, struggling to not comply.

"Excellent, now I assure you, there is nothing to fear as long as you treat me nicely, understood?"

"Yes."

"Yes.... sir."

Julie and Chris simply stared in awe at the absolute power Isaac now had over Lindsey.

"We're closing up soon, the boss wants to talk to ya" Stacy said to Isaac

As if breaking from a coma Isaac looks up from his finished pile of food wrappers and boxes and stands up with quite a bit of effort;

Stacy continues "The back room, past the fryers, it's the main office hon"

Isaac waddled into the back office and saw an athletic young man in his early twenties, behind a desk with a name tent that read "AJ" The manager stands up while Isaac meanders into his office, huffing and puffing

"Isaac, welcome to McChubbies, you're just the way I expected, have a seat"

It's immediately obvious that AJ knows something about the board game of transformation and Isaac's enormous size; Isaac eases his massive rear into one of the chairs that squeaks and groans under his girth, the arms of the seat barely accommodating Isaac's hefty width;

Finally, Isaac speaks "You *huff *puff did this but *huff why?"

Aj sits down again and smiles, "Well buddy, it's a long story but no better time to explain then now; The board game of transformation is sort of an application process.. McChubbies needs a poster child, and since the country's obesity rates have skyrocketed, a severely obese spokesman will resonate with all our consumers; So we planted the 'board game of transformation' at your school, for your friends to find, it chose you, changed you, and brought you here; You're going to be famous Isaac, your face will be Mr Chubby"

"WHAT, why me??" Isaac asked, outraged and honestly a little offended

AJ chuckled and rotated a framed picture on his desk to face Isaac, in the photo, AJ was massive, he looked just as fat as Isaac;

"Well, initially, I was setup to be the 'big guy' but I pulled some strings with the founders and they engineered the game thusly transferring my traits onto you, starting where I left off. This is a good thing Isaac, you'll be in commercials, billboards, everywhere, you'll be famous"

Isaac raised is doughy arms in the air "Why in the hell would I want my obesity in front of the entire world? I'll be a laughingstock, they'll mock me forever!"

"Yeah Isaac that's the point, there's no such thing as bad publicity, everyone will see you and respond to you" AJ added

"No! I don't want this! I'm not McChubby!!" Isaac huffed

"Well not yet, but as our campaigns launch, and you grow bigger — "

"What, WHAT? How could I possibly get any fatter??!! Look at me!!" Isaac interrupted

"Isaac, calm down, your appetite is enhanced to increase until you match our predetermined McChubby profile, it's automatic" AJ then turned on a flatscreen in the office showing, a MUCH heaver, wider, EVEN FATTER version of Isaac, grinning, wearing a brand new yellow Tshirt that simply read "McChubby" in bubbly red letters; "This will be you at the end of our next term"

"No,NO! I'm supposed to be graduating high school in a few months not some obese spectacle; I'm not supposed to be McChubby, you are!! This is all your fault!! You did this to me!!!" Isaac accused

"Forget it Isaac, we'll feed you, clothe you and you get to be a manager here until the McChubbies ad campaign launches, we need your help.. and you need ours" said AJ, gazing at Isaac massive stomach

Suddenly Isaac's insatiable hunger returned and he dove into the fast food, teary eyed, filling his mouth again and again and again and again;

Aj watched Isaac from behind the counter, smiled, and said to himself "Hah welcome to the team McChubby"

155121122122122.content:
The next few hours were a flurry of eating. Isaac's 300 or so pound body really could put food away. His parents were away for the weekend, so he wasn't even sure how they would react to the changes made to his body. Would they assume it was normal? By the small clothes in his closet (God, he had been tiny- he noted with a hint of jealousy as he felt himself rubbing against walls at odd times with his wide hips) his parents would be shocked by what they encountered on Monday, if they even thought that this was really their son. His fingerprints should be able to tell the truth, if nothing else. All 300 pplus pounds of Isaac waddled around the kitchen, grabbing food of all types to stuff his fat face with. The TV was on. but all he could think about was the food in front of him. Food had taken on a new life for him, new meaning. He loved it, he loved eating- and he hated moving.

-9 A.M. The Following Morning-

Isaac awoke with a start, still clutching an empty gallon of Rocky Road ice cream with his pudgy digits. Looking over himself, he nearly cried. It was real- it wasn't a nightmare. This was all him. With quite a struggle, he got himself to his feet, which he figured was as much a workout as he was capable of right now. Looking over himself, he realized he was still wearing his McChubbies uniform, and wondered if he actually had a job there now or something, but hoped to hell he didn't.

He'd have to get more clothes, he figured- maybe start working out? The idea seemed ludicrous. He felt that in less than 24 hours, he had been locked into this new life. Isaac grabbed his keys and headed for the door, and just as he was about to open it, the bell rang.

1553.content:
(I didn't know you couldn't create interactive stories with a free membership anymore, so this will have to do. This branch will be a good deal different from what the rest of the interactive story focuses on, but its in the same vein. Essentially, let's blow up the game and put the contestants on it. Two teams of two players, first team to cover 100 paces wins. Now, as well as having simple card effects, we'll be moving toward a more game-oriented style. Landing on certain tiles initiates a game. We'll come up with some as we go along. I'd love to get some help from people with similar tastes, and hope that this inspires a few people to write. Anyway, that's just some barebones stuff, let's come up with some options)

We'll start off with three distinct games that we can choose to play, with slightly different characters for each

Callum- Five Foot Five, 135 pounds

Lisa- Five foot Eight, 285 pounds

Option Three:

Team One (Blue)

Isaac- Five foot seven, 145 pounds

Susan- Five foot seven, 260 pounds

Team Two (Red)

Callum- Five foot five, 135 pounds

Tricia- Five foot four, 225 pounds

We've got some pretty different team setups here, with some interesting differences between team and game dynamics. These games will focus on changes that I've detailed for the board game- (WG, TG, M2BBW, Height loss/height gain, muscle loss/gain, trait swaps/transfers... anything else should be okay, but I would like to focus on these things.)
1553.title: Blow Up The Game

15531.content:
"Welcome to-" the host started, holding out his mic to the crowd for them to finish his sentence.

"The Board Game of Transformation!" they chimed in simultaneously, the host smiling gracefully as they did. He was a thin man, rather unassuming in both body and stature, but with a booming voice and a sharp sense of wit.

"That's right, folks!" he said, crossing the stage in long, elegant strides, "The only game show where the contestants change! Let's see what our contestants are playing for today, shall we?"

The screen on stage lit up with the words, "100,000 dollars!"

"That's right, a sweet 100k for each team to spend how they please!" he said with a laugh, "Speaking of teams, lets meet them, shall we?"

The crowd cheered as two teams, one clad in red and the other in blue, stepped on stage and behind their respective podiums.

"Our blue team, Isaac and Callum!" said the host, gesturing at two males, fairly short and thin, that stepped onto their podiums. Stepping on revealed some statistics about them. They were each 20 years old, Callum being the shorter and lighter player at five foot five and 135 pounds. Isaac, on the other hand, was a bit taller and heavier, five foot seven and 145 pounds. They waved and smiled at the crowd as the crowed clapped.

"And it seems we have a battle of the sexes!" the host cried out as he crossed to the other podium, "Say hello to our red team, Jenny and Lisa!"

The two teams could not have been more different. Where Isaac and Callum were thin males, Jenny and Lisa were very overweight females. Jenny, a fat, over stuffed pear who had been working at a bakery for just over a year, tipped scales at 250 pounds and measured in at five foot four and had just turned 22. Lisa, the bakery's owner, was a bit older, having just turned 29, and a good deal bigger. An even bigger pear, Lisa stood at five foot eight and weighed in at 285 pounds. They knew, however, what this game could do to you. They had to tread lightly if they wanted to stay competitive.

"Right, now we've met our teams, lets go over the rules as quickly as possible!" the host exclaimed.

A big board appeared on the screen, showing a board something like a monopoly board, though slightly bigger and with more spaces. 100 of them. At the beginning were two pieces, one red and one blue, each symbolizing a team.

"The rules are simple enough, the first team to cross the board wins, and either gets the chance to stay as they are or change back to how they were at the beginning of the game. The losing team has no choice but to stay as they are. Now, the red team won the coin toss back stage, so they get to roll first!"

Lisa waddled slowly up to a center podium with a red button on it, which caused Isaac and Callum to snicker at the large woman's significant girth. Seeing this, Jenny cheered her on, capping off her clapping with a "You got this, Lisa!"

Lisa stood before the button, took a deep breath, and smashed it. A die rolled on screen, and it finally settled on the four. The red piece moved forward four pieces, landing on a challenge spot.

"Nice work, red team!" the host shouted, "A challenge already? Let's see what we've got!"
15531.title: Game One

155312.content: The crowd waited patiently as the screen lit up- reading...
155312.title: Other!

info.brief_description: A board game with some peculiar qualities.
info.description:
Isaac and Lindsey make an interesting discovery in Lindsey's basement- a seemingly benign board game. However, the board game proves to be more powerful than either character expected when they learn it can actually physically change them- and not in ways they usually like.

The changes the board game causes are permanent, except for the changes made to the winner, who changes back. Losers are stuck how they end the game, and any attempt to quit the game will result in heavy consequences. (Which I'm too lazy to think up)

At this point, there are four characters in Lindsey's house

Isaac: 18 years old, a fit, trim male who can often see the humor in situations.

Lindsey: 18 years old a thin yet not overly thin female who often over reacts to situations.

Leslie: 16 years old Lindsey's chubby younger sister, often finds she needs to prove herself due to her weight issues. She is pear shaped like her mother.

Nora: 40 years old, Lindsey's mother, a wide hipped woman with a distinguishable pear shape. In her youth she looked exactly like Lindsey but as she has aged she has gained weight, and is even pudgier than Leslie.

Other characters will be introduced as the story progresses. (Please no anthro or furry Tfs, no insane height gains or shrinkage- and no crazy weight gain ex. 1000 pounds)

Thank you, and enjoy!
